page.title: 03INTRODUCTION (3)
page.content: {ST ANDREW'S CHURCH}In the church there is a{BAPTISIM FONT}and it has been in the church since the Normans.{The {church was built in the year 1272.}The most valuable thing is a silver challis which was given by Thomas Weir in the 16th century and it is kept in the bank.{The organ was put there in {the year 1929}.We went to the top of the tower and there were 104 steps. {There are six bells in the tower. Our overall opinion of the area was that most of the land was for dairy farming with some for crops and for growing feed. There were few houses and those seemed very old and quaint. In the original {DOMESDAY BOOK }when the area was called {HALSBRETONA}there were large woods but now it is quite different.Also then animals were a very important product as they are now.
